column1: Odeinoichus,"2017-09-15T20:04:52.05Z","The Last Jedi Walker in Miniature Scale.","
column8: >Set #30497 First Order Heavy Assault Walker:
column14: s another great looking Star Wars Polybag, while the design is a bit of odd duck from the New Trilogy era I can safely say that it does look good at such a tiny scale.

column16: >Great use of parts to capture the likeness of the new walker design for the First Order.
>Legs slightly awkward looking, difficult to pose well.

column8: >This is a pretty decent looking Polybag for the First Order and one that I recommend if you really like the new walker design. The parts are somewhat nice, though nothing too rare so there is that. Would suggest getting multiples if you&rsquo
column9: d like a really fun little walker display though.

column1: I found that there was a decent amount of pieces (although the small variety) for the money paid. I actually found this in my local Target store around the checkout counter.
Comes in a polybag with normal polybag sized instructions.

column1: The build was quick and easy took me a couple of minutes to build it.

Overall this is a nice walker. I really like the new design with this walker. The new look to the legs are really nice. My only critic to this set would be the legs are a little difficult model. Other than that this is great. It looks a lot like the larger version of it. Above the cockpit of the walker you have the heavy turret, which I really like that they incorporated into it. Overall I'
